AD_GuardsInterrupt.synopsis: Mig the Ogre says she hears things in the walls. The other two guards on duty beside her are unconvinced - one irritated, the other sympathetic but skeptical

DaisyAD_FeignSuprise.synopsis: The player has just made contact with the tentacle in the wall of Moonrise (the Elder Brain). Daisy reacts.

Tentacle.synopsis: Upon interacting with the tentacle living inside the tower's wall, player is faced with several options to choose from. - Take a sample (can be used in Mig mini quest)- Poke to see how it reacts- Examine it to learn more about it- Tear it down with brute forceDamage being done onto the tentacle will trigger a reaction from the Absolute
Tentacle.how_to_trigger: Pass the perception check in the rafters by Moonrise's kitchens. Click the crack in the wall it reveals.

Ogre.synopsis: An ogre in the guard room of Moonrise Tower. He's hearing 'meat sounds' in the wall - in actuality, a tendril of the Elder Brain no one else is aware of.

AD_TentacleShaft.synopsis: The player passed a perception check to recognise tendrils of organic matter drooping through a wall. Exploring the rafters above this spot leads to the tentacle scene.
AD_TentacleShaft.how_to_trigger: Pass a passive perception check at -129, -174 in Moonrise's kitchen.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The analysis reveals two main chains of progression. First, when exploring Moonrise Tower, the player passes a perception check that leads to AD_TentacleShaft, which lets them notice organic tendrils drooping from the wall. This discovery logically precedes the more involved interaction with the tendril in the Tentacle session, where multiple options (including possibly damaging it) are available. Making contact with the tentacle then causes Daisy to react in DaisyAD_FeignSuprise, so that session should follow Tentacle. In a separate branch, both AD_GuardsInterrupt and Ogre involve the ogre (Mig) reacting to strange sounds from the wall (referred to as 'meat sounds' or hearing things). Since these two sessions offer alternative ways of interacting with the same character and scenario, triggering one likely precludes the other; they are thus mutually exclusive.

AD_GuardsInterrupt_0.speaker: Mig
AD_GuardsInterrupt_0.text: Monster lives in this tower. Something big.

AD_GuardsInterrupt_7.speaker: Acolyte Kimmeral
AD_GuardsInterrupt_7.text: You're the biggest thing here. Nothing to be afraid of, lass.

AD_GuardsInterrupt_1.speaker: Acolyte Kimmeral
AD_GuardsInterrupt_1.text: Now Mig, come on - we told you there's nothing there.
AD_GuardsInterrupt_1.context: NodeContext: Speaking to an ogre - not unkindly, but as if she's stupid

AD_GuardsInterrupt_6.speaker: Mig
AD_GuardsInterrupt_6.context: NodeContext: Insistent, repeating something again for the 100th time

AD_GuardsInterrupt_3.speaker: Zealot Iogar
AD_GuardsInterrupt_3.text: That's a stone bloody wall. Have a taste if you don't believe us.

AD_GuardsInterrupt_8.speaker: Zealot Iogar
AD_GuardsInterrupt_8.text: If you're hearing things, maybe we ought to send you back to the war camp...
AD_GuardsInterrupt_8.context: NodeContext: Doubtfully - the ogre is acting strangely and it makes him nervous

AD_GuardsInterrupt_2.speaker: Mig
AD_GuardsInterrupt_2.context: NodeContext: Suddenly on her best behaviour - doesn't want to be sent away

AD_GuardsInterrupt_5.speaker: Acolyte Kimmeral
AD_GuardsInterrupt_5.text: Hah. Don't blame you for wanting to steer clear. Some truly gruesome sorts gathered down there.
AD_GuardsInterrupt_5.context: NodeContext: To another guard, explaining that the ogre is afraid of other monsters down at the camp

DaisyAD_FeignSuprise_1.text: Whatever that creature was, its telepathic force was unlike anything I've ever encountered. It must be the source of the Absolute.

DaisyAD_FeignSuprise_2.text: So that creature is the source of the Absolute... You must be more careful. Its telepathic force was greater than anything I've ever encountered.

DaisyAD_FeignSuprise_3.text: It said it was enslaved, but who could enslave such a thing?

DaisyAD_FeignSuprise_4.text: Careful. Whatever that was, it was immensely powerful.

Tentacle_10.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_10.text: *Again, the sickening slither of flesh on stone - barely an arm's-length away.*

Tentacle_41.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_41.text: *There is no hesitation this time - the tendrils lash out like a waiting predator.*
Tentacle_41.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaching into wall and reacting with shock as their tadpole connects with something.

Tentacle_72.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_72.text: *Again, the sickening slither of flesh on stone - barely an arm's-length away.*

Tentacle_77.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_77.text: *The tentacle pulses within the wall, waiting.*

Tentacle_145.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_145.text: *A coiling, restless void stirs within you. Your patron. For some reason, this thing in the wall excites it.*

Tentacle_104.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_104.text: *The tentacle pulses within the wall, waiting.*

Tentacle_129.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_129.text: *The sound of flesh echoes from further away - retreated beyond your reach.*

Tentacle_148.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_148.text: *Through a narrow crack in the wall, you hear something shift against stone. The pulse of a crawling, living thing.*

Tentacle_89.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_89.text: *You can't quite catch a glimpse, but you recognise this feeling - the same alien presence you felt on the nautiloid.*

Tentacle_57.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_57.text: *Your awareness unfolds, expanding through every wall in the tower - every mind.*
Tentacle_57.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaching into wall and reacting with shock as their tadpole connects with something.

Tentacle_153.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_153.text: *A vast, living network, extending down into the dark - where something wakes.*
Tentacle_153.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close on players face, wonder turning to wariness as the Brain becomes aware of them. [Trigger mind-meld aura here to show something has connected back]

Tentacle_58.speaker: Gale
Tentacle_58.text: What in the hells is that?

Tentacle_24.speaker: Wyll
Tentacle_24.text: I can feel it... looking. Deep inside...

Tentacle_47.speaker: Shadowheart
Tentacle_47.text: Gods. What is it? What now?

Tentacle_143.context:
NodeContext: telepathic, Daisy not physically present (spoken directly into the player's head)
Daisy is putting two and two together and realising this is an elder brain

Tentacle_1.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_1.text: *Tendrils snap like iron cords around your wrist. That presence in your mind looms large, closer now.*
Tentacle_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Violent lurch as tentacle grabs player, drags them slightly further into wall

Tentacle_86.speaker: Player
Tentacle_86.text: Tear your arm out of the tentacle's grip.

Tentacle_54.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_54.text: *With a soft sucking sound, your hand pulls free. The flesh within the wall retreats.*
Tentacle_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player's hand is pulled free from the wall, slight shake of pain

Tentacle_27.speaker: Gale
Tentacle_27.text: Well, now that we know what it is, I suggest we leave it well alone.

Tentacle_32.speaker: Wyll
Tentacle_32.text: I appreciate a wandering hand now and again, but maybe control your urges for now.

Tentacle_85.speaker: Lae'zel
Tentacle_85.text: Keep your hands to yourself. Every last crevice of this tower could be... infected.

Tentacle_155.speaker: Shadowheart
Tentacle_155.text: Careful, in future - you can't just stick your hand in every strange hole you come across.

Tentacle_7.speaker: Karlach
Tentacle_7.text: Let me try it next time. Looked fun.

Tentacle_25.speaker: Astarion
Tentacle_25.text: Oh, thank goodness. I was worried I'd have to get involved. Now let's keep our hands to ourselves, hmm?
Tentacle_25.context: NodeContext: Just watched the player free their hand from a tentacle

Tentacle_52.speaker: Player
Tentacle_52.text: Twist your wrist to break the grip.

Tentacle_117.speaker: Player
Tentacle_117.text: Go limp and ride it out.

Tentacle_97.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_97.text: *You stop resisting, your arm bending with the movement of the flesh. And suddenly, an opening appears.*
Tentacle_97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holding still, waiting patiently

Tentacle_131.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_131.text: *The tendrils tighten, and suddenly you are... elsewhere.*
Tentacle_131.context: CinematicNodeContext: TRANSITION: Close on players face as the shut their eyes, and open them to find a misty, featureless landscape stretching away on all sides. They are now standing straight - raising their hand to see it's no longer ensnared.

Tentacle_0.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_0.text: *The presence is no longer approaching you, but encircling you. Observing you.*

Tentacle_17.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_17.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player turning to find source as each utterance comes from another angle

Tentacle_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of great misty void from which voice emerges, player looking small in the face of it.

Tentacle_150.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_150.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player turning to find source as each utterance comes from another angle

Tentacle_82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of great misty void from which voice emerges, player looking small in the face of it.

Tentacle_139.speaker: Player
Tentacle_139.text: I am not your kin, ghaik-spawn.

Tentacle_111.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player turning to find source as each utterance comes from another angle

Tentacle_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of great misty void from which voice emerges, player looking small in the face of it.

Tentacle_115.speaker: Player
Tentacle_115.text: I know your voice. You're the Absolute.

Tentacle_119.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_119.text: *A pause, as if it struggles to compress its vast being down into terms you can understand.*
Tentacle_119.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shift from here - instead of revealing itself, Elder Brain adjusts its communication to 'our level'. Speaks in a single voice, distinct individual.

Tentacle_30.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_30.text: This is the voice they have given me. To better speak to your kind without breaking you.
Tentacle_30.context: NodeContext: Bitterness - this is a vast consciousness that has been compressed to a single, simple aspect to spare the unworthy

Tentacle_149.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_149.text: I was once a servant of the Grand Design. Now I am slave to theirs. But you...
Tentacle_149.context: NodeContext: Bitter - was once a grand being, now forced into servitude

Tentacle_68.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_68.text: You were the jewelled hope for their design, but now you are their flaw.

Tentacle_8.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_8.text: You are the flaw in their design. The single thread that could unravel everything they've planned.
Tentacle_8.context: NodeContext: Growing relish - the brain sees you as its way out, something its captors missed

Tentacle_35.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_35.text: You abandoned me... You left me the slave of the puny Chosen, used to bind this world...

Tentacle_103.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_103.context: CinematicNodeContext: Close shot of the player, as the ARTEFACT briefly materialises - then fades away again

Tentacle_114.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_114.text: You must come to me - so I can become myself again.
Tentacle_114.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of artefact floating - it fades away again, no longer needed

Tentacle_40.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_40.text: *A world away, the grip on you tightens - a desperate, drowning thing that pulls you down with it.*
Tentacle_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player flinches as in pain, then has a confused moment - realizing the pain is happening to their body in the "real world"

Tentacle_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voice goes from gentle appeal to desparate demand - return to echoing 'Elder Brain' voice.

Tentacle_79.speaker: Gale
Tentacle_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the void

Tentacle_132.speaker: Wyll
Tentacle_132.text: Come on, chief - get a hold of yourself!
Tentacle_132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the void

Tentacle_61.speaker: Lae'zel
Tentacle_61.text: What is wrong with you? Pull. Away!
Tentacle_61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the void

Tentacle_67.speaker: Shadowheart
Tentacle_67.text: Enough! Break off from that thing!
Tentacle_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the voidNodeContext: Spoken to the player. Urgent, through gritted teeth (her mind's being bombarded with psionic magic)

Tentacle_75.speaker: Karlach
Tentacle_75.text: Hello?! Hey! Snap out of it!
Tentacle_75.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the void

Tentacle_124.speaker: Astarion
Tentacle_124.text: What's happening? Speak to me. Wake up!
Tentacle_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacting to voice from the voidNodeContext: Trying to break the player out of a vision they're havig

Tentacle_16.context:
NodeContext: telepathic, Daisy not physically present (spoken directly into the player's head)
urgent, wanting to save you

Tentacle_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sudden cut to player back in MOO, thrashing against wall.

Tentacle_88.context: CinematicNodeContext: Companions are clutching their heads against psionic onslaught, unable to help

Tentacle_94.speaker: Player
Tentacle_94.text: Channel all your rage - and pull.

Tentacle_63.speaker: Player
Tentacle_63.text: Heave against the tentacle with all your might.

Tentacle_2.speaker: Player
Tentacle_2.text: Search for some leverage to slide your arm out.

Tentacle_154.speaker: Player
Tentacle_154.text: Forget subtlety - claw at whatever you can reach.

Tentacle_138.speaker: Player
Tentacle_138.text: Focus your thoughts to an edge - and cut free.

Tentacle_56.speaker: Player
Tentacle_56.text: Channel your oath. Rebuke the voice. Free yourself.

Tentacle_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player painfully wrenches free of the tentacle in the wall

Tentacle_98.speaker: Gale
Tentacle_98.text: Well, you've certainly piqued the interest of the Absolute. Though I can think of at least a dozen gods I'd rather meet.

Tentacle_84.speaker: Wyll
Tentacle_84.text: Was - was that Her? The Absolute?

Tentacle_18.speaker: Lae'zel
Tentacle_18.text: That voice. Like nothing I've ever heard...

Tentacle_5.speaker: Lae'zel
Tentacle_5.text: Next time, stay your hand. The Absolute may be keen to speak, but I don't share Her enthusiasm.

Tentacle_42.speaker: Shadowheart
Tentacle_42.text: You're free... The Absolute must be keen to meet us.
Tentacle_42.context: NodeContext: 'Is this a good thing, or a very bad thing?'

Tentacle_44.speaker: Karlach
Tentacle_44.text: The Absolute fairly ripped your hand off. That's no way to tempt us into a meeting.

Tentacle_126.speaker: Astarion
Tentacle_126.text: Thank goodness - I was almost worried.

Tentacle_101.speaker: Astarion
Tentacle_101.text: Clingy little shit, this Absolute. And She wants to meet...

Tentacle_48.text: It almost had you. You did well to pull away from it.
Tentacle_48.context:
NodeContext: telepathic, Daisy not physically present (spoken directly into the player's head)
relieved, still coming down from the urgency of the moment before

Tentacle_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player flails against tentacle as it continues to pin them. Close on their panicked face as they're suddenly teleported. [Brief VFX and quick fade to white might be sufficient}

Tentacle_127.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_127.text: They name themselves 'Chosen', but they are slavers. They will use me to bind this world...

Tentacle_91.speaker: Player
Tentacle_91.text: What do you mean I'm the flaw?

Tentacle_51.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_51.text: I am the chain they will use to bind this world...

Tentacle_106.speaker: Player
Tentacle_106.text: Show yourself. What are you really?

Tentacle_39.speaker: Player
Tentacle_39.text: I don't care about any design. I just want to be free of the tadpole.

Tentacle_80.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_80.text: There is no freedom. They will use me to bind the world in chains...

Tentacle_113.speaker: Player
Tentacle_113.text: Take me out of here. Now.

Tentacle_73.speaker: Absolute Voice
Tentacle_73.text:
--not out---
-inward--
--you are here - here is you--

Tentacle_62.speaker: Player
Tentacle_62.text: Invite the presence in. There's always room for one more.

Tentacle_92.speaker: Astarion
Tentacle_92.text: What in the hells - oh no. Not again.

Tentacle_100.speaker: Narrator
Tentacle_100.text: *You almost catch a glimpse, but the darkness within the wall is too deep.*

Ogre_1.speaker: Mig
Ogre_1.context: NodeContext: Quieting us, listening  /  (MartinK) - Distracted, focused on walls as sound is sublte. It may be something she can eat... or might eat her

Ogre_5.speaker: Narrator
Ogre_5.text: *And for a moment, you do hear it - the brain tendril you encountered, shifting through the tower walls.*
Ogre_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacts to hearing something above

Ogre_15.speaker: Player
Ogre_15.text: There's a being living within the walls.

Ogre_25.speaker: Player
Ogre_25.text: It's some kind of illithid being.

Ogre_20.speaker: Mig
Ogre_20.context: NodeContext: Nodding along with your answer, but thinks you're an idiot for missing the point

Ogre_21.speaker: Mig
Ogre_21.text: Bah. Mig thought True Souls was brave.

Ogre_23.speaker: Mig
Ogre_23.text: Blech. No. Mig stick to foe-flesh - nice and sweet.

Ogre_7.speaker: Mig
Ogre_7.context: NodeContext: Confused, then happy realisation - this idea makes sense

Ogre_2.speaker: Mig
Ogre_2.text: Mig join up for food. If god is made of meat... it all make sense now.

Ogre_38.speaker: Narrator
Ogre_38.text: *For a moment, you do hear it - flesh sliding on stone, like a living being extending through the walls.*
Ogre_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacts to hearing something above.

Ogre_22.speaker: Player
Ogre_22.text: Something in the walls? What is it?

Ogre_27.speaker: Mig
Ogre_27.text: Big. In walls above. Maybe whole tower.
Ogre_27.context: NodeContext: confused, looking up, looking down - trying to figure out where something behind the walls is

Ogre_35.speaker: Mig
Ogre_35.text: Loudest near kitchen, but Mig banned. Not allowed to pet gnolls.
Ogre_35.context: NodeContext: A little sulkily at the end - she's not allowed to pet the monstrous humanoid hyenas

Ogre_11.speaker: Mig
Ogre_11.text: No! Mig only small. This huge. In walls above. Maybe whole tower.
Ogre_11.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - we don't get it

Ogre_30.speaker: Mig
Ogre_30.context: NodeContext: Warning and utterly earnest - a child making you pinky swear to share your treat

Ogre_10.speaker: Player
Ogre_10.text: I think you might just be hearing things.

Ogre_39.speaker: Mig
Ogre_39.text: No! Mig know meat. This big meat. In walls above. Maybe whole tower.
Ogre_39.context: NodeContext: Frustrated - we don't get it

Ogre_17.speaker: Mig
Ogre_17.context: NodeContext: A little glum - she's restricted to a boring diet now

Ogre_18.speaker: Mig
Ogre_18.context: NodeContext: not shouting - he's trying to hush us as if we're an annoying child

Ogre_28.speaker: Player
Ogre_28.text: I encountered the being living in the walls.

Ogre_19.speaker: Player
Ogre_19.text: Where did you hear the meat-sounds, again?

Ogre_3.speaker: Mig
Ogre_3.text: In walls above. Loudest near kitchens, but maybe whole tower. Like... like...

Ogre_24.speaker: Mig
Ogre_24.text: ...like we inside meat. Mig eat meat... or meat eat Mig...?
Ogre_24.context: NodeContext: Trailing off into the grandest existential crisis an ogre could have

Ogre_26.speaker: Mig
Ogre_26.context: NodeContext: Joyous - enthusastic believer in the Absolute now

AD_TentacleShaft_0.speaker: Player
AD_TentacleShaft_0.text: Something slimy seems to be dripping from the rafters above.
